content: Stadium in Singapore **Yio Chu Kang Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) located in [Ang Mo Kio](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio), Singapore. It has a seating capacity of 2,000. It is run by [Sport Singapore](/wiki/Sport_Singapore) and was opened to the public on 1 April 1985. It is a rugby specific stadium with 8-lane running track. ## History In December 2015, [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong_national_under-20_rugby_union_team) played against [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_rugby_union_team) during the [2015 U-19 Asia Rugby Championship](/wiki/2015_U-19_Asia_Rugby_Championship) held at the stadium. The Singapore side lost the game 10â€“61. On 7 December 2019, the Special Olympics South-east Asia Unified 5-a-side Football Tournament kicked off in Singapore at the stadium seven years after its inauguration. ## Transport The stadium is accessible by [MRT](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)), bus and taxi and it is a short walk from [Yio Chu Kang MRT station](/wiki/Yio_Chu_Kang_MRT_station). - [List of stadiums in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_stadiums_in_Singapore) This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Yio Chu Kang Stadium
